content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
This paper proposes an electrophysiological wireless patient monitoring system which integrates a Wireless ECG signal transmitter, GPS device and a mobile phone to acquire physiological signals and transmit them to a local server via Bluetooth wireless technology. Four kinds of monitor units were specially designed for a wireless communication, including a control center , a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a Web page (for both patient and doctor). The use of various monitor units is created to fulfill different medical personnel requirements and wishes. This application was developed to promote the mobility and flexibility for the patients and also for the medical personnel, which further will improve both the quality of health care and lifestyle of the patient.

DC: High school student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is high. It contains technical terms and concepts related to electrophysiology, wireless technology, and medical monitoring systems that may be difficult for a high school student to understand. The structure is also complex, with multiple ideas presented in long sentences.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (High school student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage

The section "an electrophysiological wireless patient monitoring system which integrates a Wireless ECG signal transmitter, GPS device and a mobile phone to acquire physiological signals and transmit them to a local server via Bluetooth wireless technology" is complicated.
Simplify this section
This paper presents a wireless patient monitoring system that includes a heart monitor, GPS, and a mobile phone to collect health signals and send them to a nearby server using Bluetooth.
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage

This paper presents a wireless patient monitoring system that includes a heart monitor, GPS, and a mobile phone to collect health signals and send them to a nearby server using Bluetooth. Four kinds of monitor units were specially designed for wireless communication, including a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistant; PDA), and a web page (for both patient and doctor). The use of various monitor units is created to fulfill different medical personnel requirements and wishes. This application was developed to promote mobility and flexibility for patients and medical personnel, which will further improve both the quality of health care and the lifestyle of the patient.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

The information loss in the updated passage is minimal, as the main components and functions of the system are still conveyed. However, the specific term "electrophysiological" is removed, which simplifies the language but may lose the nuance regarding the type of signals being monitored. The severity of this information loss can be considered medium, as it shifts the focus from technical specificity to general understanding but still retains the essential function of the system.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text

This paper presents a wireless patient monitoring system that includes a heart monitor, GPS, and a mobile phone to collect health signals and send them to a nearby server using Bluetooth. Four types of monitor units were designed for wireless communication: a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistants; PDA), and a web page for both patients and doctors. These various monitor units are created to meet different needs and preferences of medical personnel. This application was developed to promote mobility and flexibility for both patients and medical staff, which will enhance the quality of health care and the patients' lifestyles.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the passage is now moderate. It uses simpler language and sentence structures compared to the original version, making it more accessible to a high school student. While some technical terms remain, they are better explained and contextualized, improving overall readability.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (High school student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Provide the final version of the simplified passage

This paper presents a wireless patient monitoring system that includes a heart monitor, GPS, and a mobile phone to collect health signals and send them to a nearby server using Bluetooth. Four types of monitor units were designed for wireless communication: a control center, a local monitor unit, mobile devices (personal digital assistants; PDA), and a web page for both patients and doctors. These various monitor units are created to meet different needs and preferences of medical personnel. This application was developed to promote mobility and flexibility for both patients and medical staff, which will enhance the quality of health care and the patients' lifestyles.
